EINSTEIN PERSONALIZATION
Attribution Settings for Restricted GA

For restricted GA, we’ve provided four attribution DMOs.  These DMOs gather metrics using specific engagement models, settings, metrics, and attribution rules.

ATTRIBUTION VALUES	SETTING	DESCRIPTION
Engagement Model	Click-Based Model	Attribution eligible metrics, like cart conversions, orders, and revenue, are attributed to clicking on personalized content.
View/Impression-based Model	Attribution eligible metrics, like cart conversions, orders, and revenue, are attributed to viewing personalized content.  Revenue is considered attributed if the individual has seen the content; direct engagement with the content is not required.
Attribution Window	7 days	The attribution window is the maximum allowed time between two engagements for a conversion to occur.  For example, if an individual engages with recommended content, revenue from them ordering that content within the 7 day engagement window is counted for that personalization point. Any revenue for orders outside of the engagement window are not counted.
Attribution/Business Metrics	Orders	The number of discrete orders containing recommended content that were purchased within the attribution window.
Revenue	The total amount of revenue for orders containing recommended content that was purchased within the attribution window.
Attribution Model	Last Touch	

The mechanism used for assigning attribution of business key performance indicators to engagements.  The attribution model is used when there are multiple qualifying engagements.

For the last touch attribution model, multiple qualifying engagements for a desired business conversion are resolved by assigning the last engagement 100% of the value.  For example, if an individual purchases a product that was recommended 3 different times within the attribution window, the last engagement (view or impression) receives 100% of the value for that purchase.
